alert.note: Alert for Bucks; Delaware; Montgomery; Philadelphia (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 07 at 9:22PM EST until March 07 at 11:00PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1000 PM EST FOR NORTHERN ATLANTIC...NORTHERN SALEM...OCEAN...CAMDEN...SOUTH CENTRAL MERCER...GLOUCESTER...BURLINGTON...SOUTHWESTERN MONMOUTH... SOUTHEASTERN MONTGOMERY...SOUTHEASTERN BUCKS...PHILADELPHIA AND SOUTHEASTERN DELAWARE COUNTIES... At 921 PM EST, severe showers and embedded thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Levittown to Woodstown, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. Locations impacted include... Philadelphia, Toms River, Camden, Gloucester City, Lakewood, Cherry Hill, Bensalem, Jackson, Evesham, Mount Laurel, Willingboro, Deptford, Voorhees, Medford, West Deptford, Barnegat, Glassboro, Lindenwold, Hammonton and Pennsville. This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike between exits 1 and 7A. Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 349 and 359. Interstate 95 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 10 and 40. Interstate 76 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 344 and 351. Interstate 76 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 3. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 5 and 58. Interstate 676 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 1. Interstate 676 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 4. Garden State Parkway between mile markers 46 and 92. Atlantic City Expressway between mile markers 21 and 44. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. This line of heavy showers and embedded thunderstorms may contain little or no lightning. Do not wait until you hear thunder before taking cover.
